results.title: Sports medicine
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Don Murray
results.brief_description: In the past two decades, performances in sport have improved greatly. Athletes are running faster, jumping longer and higher and have more endurance. It is mainly due to the increasing application of science through the result of devising better methods and longer periods of training. This scientific and systematic approach to getting fit and keeping fit is called Sports Medicine.

results.title: Sports for life
results.brief_description: Discusses reasons for taking up sport, such as the value of exercise for physical health, the development of self reliance and self discipline, a relaxation and break from work and the development of cooperation through the participation in team sports.

results.title: Sports for elementary: playing basketball

results.title: Sports cycling
results.creator_credit: Antares Cinematografica Rome, Federation Internationale Amateur de Cyclisme and Piero Costa
results.brief_description: Presents every aspect of preparation for competitive sports cycling, from an understanding of the anatomy and physiology of cycling through to extensive fitness tests, the design of a racing machine, winter training, diet, exercise, massage and tactical instruction and preparation for road and track events. The most important racing techniques are also explained using slow motion and illustrated in action using footage from the Rome Olympics.

results.title: Sports challenge = Sports divers
results.creator_credit: Gaston Sarault, ONF | NFB and Judith Klein
results.brief_description: A comic cartoon, without commentary, showing that not everyone who rises to the challenge of sport can be sure of success. Pictured is a man with middle-aged flab who tackles the whole range of contemporary sports - swimming, bicycling, golfing, gymnastics, jogging - with great eagerness but equal ineptitude. At a time when physical fitness is much on the public mind, Sports Challenge is a friendly warning that fitness is not necessarily an inborn trait.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gaston Sarault, ONF | NFB and Judith Klein

results.title: Sports amateurs
results.creator_credit: Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Studio of the People's Republic of China
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China Today”.
Newsreel presenting a rich variety of physical activities in China including the martial arts; winter sports such as skating and skiing; track and field; and roller skating.

results.title: Sporting scooters
results.brief_description: In the fifties, Italian manufacturers captured the unique style of the scooter with Vespa and Lambretta. Their approach to manufacturing scooters proved hugely popular. This programme take a nostalgic look at the fun enjoyed by many scooter enthusiasts of this time. It includes footage from the fifties of rallys, races and other scooter sports throughout Great Britain.

results.title: Sport. [Ep. 2/73]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items covering various sports in Germany including: 1. Horse teams of four in hand. 2. Testing synthetic running shoes and sy;nthetic ski runs. 3. Stock car racing. 4. Combination flying machine and boat. 5. Breeding race horses.
